title: Central Pain Syndrome: Prevalence and Associated Conditions
short_description: Clinical overview of central pain syndrome prevalence rates across different neurological conditions including stroke, spinal cord injury, and multiple sclerosis.
long_description: This document provides epidemiological data on central pain syndrome, a neurological condition affecting millions worldwide. It presents specific prevalence statistics showing that 5-10% of stroke patients, 20-40% of spinal cord injury patients, and approximately 30% of multiple sclerosis patients develop this condition. The document serves as a reference for understanding the scope and impact of central pain syndrome across various neurological patient populations, highlighting its significance as a secondary complication in neurological disorders.
